title.narrative: EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS/DRR

description.narrative: Improved knowledge and capacity of public authorities, service providers and communities in identified disaster-prone and climate- risk areas to prepare for and respond to emergencies, reduce disaster risks, strengthen resilience and mitigate climate change impacts., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Adolescent Health And Nutrition (Covid), Child Health, Child Health (Covid), Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Early Childhood Development, Early Childhood Development (Covid), Environmental Sustainability, Health And Emergencies, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Maternal And Newborn Health, Micronutrients, Nutrition And Emergencies, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas (Covid), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Supply And Logistics, Supply And Logistics (Covid), Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Wash And Emergencies. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, country and government leaders, policymakers and decision-makers and other key stakeholders across society utilize robust knowledge and evidence to inform the development of equitable policies, programmes, public communication and advocacy to improve the situation of the most disadvantaged and vulnerable children and women.

participating-org.narrative: CHINA NATIONAL SOCIETY FOR EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION

Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Sanitation in emergencies - improving sanitation services in communities
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)

Water supply and Sanitation rural sanitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved knowledge and capacity of public authorities, service providers and communities in identified disaster-prone and climate-risk areas to prepare for and respond to emergencies, reduce disaster risks, strengthen resilience and mitigate climate changeimpacts.

description.narrative: UNICEF provided immediate support to the Government after the COVID-19 outbreak, and continuously worked with the Government in response to health, education, child protection and other sectors. UNICEF also supported the response to Jiangxi’s flooding through the provision of education supplies. In order to better prepare local communities in future disasters, UNICEF continued to collaborate with the National Disaster Reduction Center of China, Sichuan Disaster Reduction Center, and a local non-governmental organization (NGO) to strengthen communities’ capacities in emergency preparedness with necessary equipment and preparedness kits in place. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/02/2021
